required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Gemcitabine and Z650 in Treating Patients With Metastatic or Recurrent Pancreatic Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase Ib, Multi-center, Open-label Study of Z650 and Gemcitabine in Advanced Pancreatic Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This phase IB trial is studying how well giving gemcitabine together with Z650 works in treating patients with metastatic or recurrent pancreatic cancer.

detailed_description.textblock: This phase IB trial is studying how well giving gemcitabine together with Z650 works in treating patients with metastatic or recurrent pancreatic cancer.This phase IB trial is Multi-center and open。

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of dose limiting toxicities of each subject
primary_outcome.description: Rate will be assessed through summaries of adverse events, clinical laboratory abnormalities, and changes in physical exam and vital signs. All subjects who receive a single dose of study medication will be considered evaluable for safety.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse events related to pulse dose Z650 and gemcitabine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 4 weeks after last dose
secondary_outcome.description: description, timing, grade (Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events Version 5.0 [CTCAE v5.0]), severity, seriousness, and relatedness

Overall response rate (ORR), defined as a partial response (PR) or complete response (CR) occurring at any point post-treatment according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors as assessed by RECIST v1.1
DCR, proportion of patients with best overall response of CR, PR or stable disease (SD)
DOR, defined as time from the first documented CR or PR to first documented progression or death due to any cause
PFS, defined as time from date of treatment to disease progression or death due to any cause
OS, defined as time from date of treatment to death due to any cause

arm_group.description: Z650:250 or 300 or 200 mg/d, starting on the 2nd day, once a day, continuous administration, or about half an hour after a meal Gemcitabine: intravenously at 1000 mg/m2 on Days 1, 8, of a 21-day cycle FOR the 4-6 cycles

intervention.description: 250 or 300 or 200 mg/d, starting on the 2nd day, once a day, continuous administration, or about half an hour after a meal
Gemcitabine will be administered intravenously at 1000 mg/m2 on Days 1, 8, of a 21-day cycle ，for 4-6 cycles

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
18 ≤ age ≤ 75 years old, male or female is not limited; Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status (PS) 0 or 1 Life expectancy of ≥ 12 weeks Pathologically confirmed advanced pancreatic cancer defined as non-operable in a curative intent, locally recurrent, or metastatic disease.
Exclusion Criteria:
adjuvant treatment with gemcitabine within 6 months prior to the first dose; Radiotherapy and anti-cancer Chinese patent medicine treatment were performed within 4 weeks before the first dose; Gastrointestinal diseases that could affect the absorption of Z650, (e.g., serious swallowing obstruction, chronic diarrhea, bowel obstruction); Doppler ultrasound evaluation of Left ventricular ejection fraction < 50%

overall_official.affiliation: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University
